newsitem.title: USA: CME hog calls mixed, pork bellies seen higher.
newsitem.headline: CME hog calls mixed, pork bellies seen higher.

text.p: Early calls on CME hog futures ranged from 0.100 cent per lb lower to 0.100 higher while pork bellies were expected to open 0.200 to 0.400 cent per lb higher, livestock analysts said.
Further fund rolling following the start of the "Goldman roll" Wednesday could make for uneven price movement in hog futures early, sources said. Mixed fundamentals may also make for choppy trade.
Cash hogs were called steady to lower as rainy weather in the Midwest kept farmers out of fields and left them time to sell hogs.
The ensuing larger runs were seen weighing on hog prices but higher pork cutout values could prove supportive to futures, sources said.
